intro: Antiaropsis uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower antiaropsis, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and distinctive yellowish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
